title: Blox Fruits: How to Get the Mythical Shadow Fruit

steps.title: Shadow Fruit is a Mythical Natural-type Blox Fruit.
steps.content: Shadow Fruit is a Mythical Natural-type Blox Fruit. You can get it from the Blox Fruit Dealer for $2,900,000 or 2,425 Robux. It's a purple fruit with a glowing pink face and gray bat wings on each side, and it was released in 2021.

steps.title: Shadow is a good PvP fruit in the Third Sea.
steps.content: Shadow is a good PvP fruit in the Third Sea. It's not recommended to use Shadow Fruit in the First or Second Sea as it has high mastery requirements. It's a good PvP fruit since it can do a lot of damage, but it's not the best PvP fruit available.

steps.title: Somber Rebellion (Z)
steps.content: Somber Rebellion ( Z ) Mastery cost: 1 Mastery Description: You turn into a shadow orb and dash towards the cursor location. If you hit an enemy you will turn into a bat swarm that does damage. You will then fly up into the sky and leave the enemy on the ground. This move breaks instinct.

steps.title: Shade Nest (X)
steps.content: Shade Nest ( X ) Mastery cost: 100 Mastery Description: You shoot a bat swarm towards the cursor location. If this swarm hits an enemy, it will explode into a flurry of bats that do damage. Some bats will fly off and hit nearby enemies. This move does not break instinct.

steps.title: Nightmare Leech (C)
steps.content: Nightmare Leech ( C ) Mastery cost: 200 Mastery Description: You dash forward, stealing health from an enemy. You will get 20% of your max health back, plus do damage to the enemy. The enemy will also be knocked back. This move will always break instinct.

steps.title: Corvus Torment (V)
steps.content: Corvus Torment ( V ) Mastery cost: 300 Mastery Description: You turn into a giant shadow orb and explode into a cloud of darkness. This will drain your Umbra Meter (see the section on passives below ) and do lots of damage to nearby enemies, and it will also break instinct. The explosion will leave behind a bat swarm that will damage enemies left inside the cloud. The cloud will also pull enemies back into it if they try to run away. The higher your Umbra Meter is, the bigger the explosion and shadow cloud will be.

steps.title: Umbrage (F)
steps.content: Umbrage ( F ) Mastery cost: 50 Mastery Description: You turn into a bat swarm and can fly for 10 seconds. If you fly near an enemy, bats from the swarm will fly into them to damage them. This move does not break instinct at all.

steps.title: Umbra Meter
steps.content: Umbra Meter As you deal damage to enemies with Shadow Fruit's abilities, the Umbra Meter will gradually fill. Shadow's Corvus Torment move is the only thing that can drain the Umbra Meter. [1] X Research source The Umbra Meter will also fill automatically at night time. When using the Shadow Fruit, a dark aura will surround your character. This aura gets more intense the higher your Umbra Meter is, but this is purely cosmetic.

steps.title: Pros
steps.content: Pros Good for PvP, especially aerial Can be used to grind bosses Easy to obtain compared to other Mythical fruit Good mobility High damage

steps.title: Cons
steps.content: Cons High mastery requirement Not good to grind groups of enemies Not all moves can hit Sea Beasts Passive is hard to regenerate during the day Low trade value
